Navigate to other release versions of Doxee Platform Composer

[6.6](https://docs.doxee.com/docs/en/composer-6-6)

[6.7](https://docs.doxee.com/docs/en/composer-6-7)

The Link element can be used to add hyperlinks to a document. The digitally rendered document will contain a clickable link which opens the referenced URL in the same browser tab or jumps to the referenced block in the same document, depending on the configuration of the link.

A link can be placed on text or image elements. There are two ways to create a link:

- Drag-and-drop the Link element from the Palette into the editor area

- Range-select content in the editor area and click the![](data:image/png;base64,) link icon in the floating toolbar

The created link will be marked in the editor area with a superscripted ![](data:image/png;base64,) icon. Click the icon to open the Styles &amp; Properties tab and configure the element.

![](data:image/png;base64,)

The configurable properties of a Link element are:

- **Type**: Determines whether the link points to an external URL or to a block within the same document. Select one of the options from the drop-down menu:

*internal*: Leads to a referenced block within the same document

- *external*: Opens a URL in the same browser tab

- **Path**: Defines the referenced external URL or internal block ID. Enter the link destination in the text input field.

*ID*: Enter the exact ID of the block to which the link should point (only within the same document)

- *URL*: Enter the URL to which the link should point. You can check the validity of the URL by clicking the globe icon next to the input field; the URL will be opened in the same browser tab.

> Itâ€™s recommended to enter the full URL including the protocol prefix, for example [http://www.doxee.com](http://www.doxee.com/). The reason for this is that a relative URL, for example [www.doxee.com,](http://www.doxee.com/) will be resolved relatively to the current URL when the globe icon is clicked, leading to an invalid web page.
